me.lokka30.levelledmobs

Class LevelInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.lokka30.levelledmobs.LevelInterface

  • public class LevelInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Welcome to the LevelInterface, this class is a 'global' interface for LM itself AND other plugins to apply and modify the main functions of LevelledMobs.
    Since:
    2.5
    Author:
    lokka30

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LevelInterface.AdditionalLevelInformation 
      static class  LevelInterface.LevellableState
      This provides information on if a mob is levellable or not, and if not, a reason is supplied.

    • Field Detail

      • FORCED_BLOCKED_ENTITY_TYPES

        public final java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> FORCED_BLOCKED_ENTITY_TYPES
        The following entity types MUST be not levellable. Stored as Strings since older versions may not contain certain entity type constants

      • OTHER_HOSTILE_MOBS

        public final java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> OTHER_HOSTILE_MOBS
        The following entity types must be manually ALLOWED in 'getLevellableState', as they are not instanceof Monster or Boss Stored as Strings since older versions may not contain certain entity type constants

      • getLevellableState

        @NotNull
public LevelInterface.LevellableState getLevellableState(@NotNull
                                                                   org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity)
        Check if an existing mob is allowed to be levelled, according to the user's configuration.

        Thread-safety intended, but not tested.

        Parameters:
        livingEntity - target mob
        Returns:
        if the mob is allowed to be levelled (yes/no), with reason

      • getLevellableState

        @NotNull
public LevelInterface.LevellableState getLevellableState(@NotNull
                                                                   org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
        Check if a mob is allowed to be levelled, according to the user's configuration. Developers, please ensure you understand that this method does not account for certain things such as 'is mob tamed?', WorldGuard regions, blocked worlds, etc, which the user may have disabled, and this method is unable to factor that in. Where possible, use isLevellable(LivingEntity). Thread-safety intended, but not tested.
        Parameters:
        entityType - target entity type
        Returns:
        of the mob is allowed to be levelled (yes/no), with reason

      • getLevellableState

        @NotNull
public LevelInterface.LevellableState getLevellableState(@NotNull
                                                                   org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType,
                                                                   @NotNull
                                                                   org.bukkit.Location location)
        Check if a mob is allowed to be levelled, according to the user's configuration. Developers, please ensure you understand that this method does not account for certain things such as 'is mob tamed?', which the user may have disabled, and this method is unable to factor that in. Where possible, use isLevellable(LivingEntity). Thread-safety intended, but not tested.
        Parameters:
        entityType - target entity type
        location - target location
        Returns:
        if the mob is allowed to be levelled (yes/no), with reason

      • generateLevel

        public int generateLevel(@NotNull
                         org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity)
        This method generates a level for the mob. It utilises the levelling mode specified by the administrator through the settings.yml configuration. Thread-safety intended, but not tested.
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - the entity to generate a level for
        Returns:
        a level for the entity

      • generateLevel

        public int generateLevel(@NotNull
                         org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity,
                         int minLevel,
                         int maxLevel)
        This method generates a level for the mob. It utilises the levelling mode specified by the administrator through the settings.yml configuration. Thread-safety intended, but not tested.
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - the entity to generate a level for
        minLevel - the minimum level to be used for the mob
        maxLevel - the maximum level to be used for the mob
        Returns:
        a level for the entity

      • applyLevelToMob

        public void applyLevelToMob(@NotNull
                            org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity,
                            int level,
                            boolean isSummoned,
                            boolean bypassLimits,
                            @NotNull
                            java.util.HashSet<LevelInterface.AdditionalLevelInformation> additionalLevelInformation)
        This method applies a level to the target mob.

        You can run this method on a mob regardless if they are already levelled or not.

        This method DOES NOT check if it is LEVELLABLE. It is assumed that plugins make sure this is the case (unless they intend otherwise).

        It is highly recommended to leave bypassLimits = false, unless the desired behaviour is to override the user-configured limits.

        Thread-safety intended, but not tested.

        Parameters:
        livingEntity - target mob
        level - the level the mob should have
        isSummoned - if the mob was spawned by LevelledMobs, not by the server
        bypassLimits - whether LM should disregard max level, etc.
        additionalLevelInformation - used to determine the source event

      • isLevelled

        public boolean isLevelled(@NotNull
                          org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity)
        Check if a LivingEntity is a levelled mob or not. This is determined *after* MobPreLevelEvent.

        Thread-safety intended, but not tested.

        Parameters:
        livingEntity - living entity to check
        Returns:
        if the mob is levelled or not

        public int getLevelOfMob(@NotNull

        Retrieve the level of a levelled mob. Thread-safety intended, but not tested.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
